intro: Vernonia lithospermifolia, commonly known as the rock coreopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Vernonia lithospermifolia is drought-tolerant and thrives in full sun, making it a suitable ornamental plant in arid landscapes.
